questions.question: Which protocol performs the first signaling exchange between the gNB and AMF during the NG Setup procedure?

explanations.a: Incorrect — GTP-U carries user-plane traffic, not signaling.
explanations.b: Correct — NGAP (Next Generation Application Protocol) handles signaling between gNB and AMF during NG Setup.
explanations.c: Incorrect — SCTP is the transport layer, not the signaling protocol itself.
explanations.d: Incorrect — IPsec provides security but not signaling.

questions.question: Before sending the NG Setup Request, what must be established between the gNB and AMF?

explanations.a: Incorrect — UDP is not used for NGAP signaling.
explanations.b: Incorrect — GTP-U is for user-plane data, not control signaling.
explanations.c: Correct — SCTP association must be established for NGAP messages between gNB and AMF.
explanations.d: Incorrect — NGAP does not use TCP.

questions.question: Which field in the NG Setup Request identifies the tracking location of the gNB?

explanations.a: Incorrect — GUAMI identifies the AMF region, not the gNB location.
explanations.b: Correct — TAC (Tracking Area Code) defines the location tracking area for the gNB.
explanations.d: Incorrect — QFI is used for QoS flows.

questions.question: The NG Setup Response message contains which of the following to identify the core network’s identity and region?

explanations.a: Incorrect — PLMN identifies the operator, not the AMF region.
explanations.b: Incorrect — S-NSSAI identifies a network slice.
explanations.c: Correct — GUAMI uniquely identifies the AMF region and instance within the core network.
explanations.d: Incorrect — TEID is used in GTP-U for data tunnels.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the N3 interface?

explanations.a: Incorrect — Authentication is handled via N1/N2 interfaces.
explanations.b: Incorrect — Control signaling is carried over N2.
explanations.c: Correct — N3 carries user-plane data between gNB and UPF using GTP-U.
explanations.d: Incorrect — Paging is part of control plane signaling.

questions.question: Which port does GTP-U use for transporting user plane packets?

explanations.a: Incorrect — 38412 is used for SCTP in NGAP signaling.
explanations.b: Correct — GTP-U uses UDP port 2152 for user-plane traffic.
explanations.c: Incorrect — 8080 is a standard HTTP port.
explanations.d: Incorrect — 110 is used for POP3 email service.

questions.question: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is used to:

answers.b: Identify the PDU session in GTP-U tunnels

explanations.a: Incorrect — TEID does not identify UEs.
explanations.b: Correct — TEID (Tunnel Endpoint Identifier) uniquely identifies a GTP-U tunnel per PDU session.
explanations.c: Incorrect — AMF name is a logical identifier.
explanations.d: Incorrect — PLMN configuration is independent of TEID.

questions.question: During PDU Session Resource Setup, the UL TEID is provided by:

explanations.a: Incorrect — AMF is not involved in TEID assignment.
explanations.b: Correct — The UPF provides the uplink TEID to the SMF during PDU session setup.
explanations.c: Incorrect — The gNB uses the provided TEID, not assigns it.
explanations.d: Incorrect — SMF coordinates setup but does not generate TEIDs.

questions.question: Which message initiates the activation of the N3 interface?

explanations.a: Incorrect — NG Setup establishes N2 signaling.
explanations.b: Correct — PDU Session Resource Setup Request initiates N3 tunnel setup between gNB and UPF.
explanations.c: Incorrect — GTP-U tunnels are created dynamically.

questions.question: The default paging DRX value in the NG Setup Request is used to define:

explanations.a: Incorrect — Slicing is unrelated to DRX.
explanations.b: Correct — DRX defines the interval between paging cycles for idle-mode UEs.
explanations.c: Incorrect — AMF region is determined by GUAMI.
explanations.d: Incorrect — DRX is not related to tunnel overhead.

questions.question: Which protocol stack is used for NGAP messages between gNB and AMF?

explanations.a: Incorrect — UDP is not used for NGAP signaling.
explanations.b: Correct — NGAP messages are carried over SCTP on top of IP and Ethernet.
explanations.c: Incorrect — TCP is not used for NGAP transport.
explanations.d: Incorrect — GTP-U carries user-plane traffic, not signaling.

questions.question: In uplink data flow, GTP-U packets from the gNB are encapsulated using which outer source and destination IP addresses?

explanations.a: Incorrect — UE is not directly addressed in GTP-U.
explanations.b: Incorrect — UE traffic is encapsulated by gNB.
explanations.c: Correct — GTP-U packets travel from gNB (source) to UPF (destination).
explanations.d: Incorrect — That is the downlink path.

questions.question: What part of the PDU session setup message indicates the slice being used?

explanations.a: Incorrect — PLMN ID identifies the operator.
explanations.b: Correct — S-NSSAI (Single Network Slice Selection Assistance Information) identifies the network slice for the PDU session.
explanations.c: Incorrect — DRX relates to UE sleep cycles.
explanations.d: Incorrect — GUAMI identifies AMF region and instance.

questions.question: Which component in the 5G Core is primarily responsible for session management and TEID allocation?

explanations.a: Incorrect — AMF manages signaling, not TEIDs.
explanations.b: Correct — SMF allocates TEIDs and manages session establishment with UPF.
explanations.c: Incorrect — UPF provides TEIDs but under SMF direction.

questions.question: In the SBA Simulator Dashboard, what is the correct sequence to start the 5G network functions?

answers.a: Start gNB first, then core NFs
answers.b: Start all core NFs, then gNB

explanations.a: Incorrect — gNB must connect to already running core NFs.
explanations.b: Correct — Core NFs (AMF, SMF, UPF, etc.) should start first, followed by gNB to establish connections.
explanations.c: Incorrect — UPF alone cannot handle signaling.
explanations.d: Incorrect — Both AMF and SMF are required to be running before gNB starts.
